Text.Value: I've seen markings like these. Ancient githyanki inscriptions. Whatever this box, it's significant.
Wow. It must be love.
*Such a curious artefact. So small and seemingly harmless, and yet it contains so much.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player pulls puzzle box out of inventory
EditorData.logicalname: PLAYERS VISITED ASTRAL PRISON IN CRE AND MET DAISY

Text.Value: Staring at it won't provide any more answers, unfortunately. There's power to it - that's for certain.
Force it open.
A box that simply refuses to be toyed with. Happens to the best of us.
*Nothing.*
What a pretty thing. I imagine it's dangerous - most pretty things are.
There's something about that thing - can't keep my eyes off it.
Examine it more closely.
By Vlaakith - we may not forsake it, nor it us.
Perhaps it needs a magic word? Try 'please'. Or 'sledgehammer'.

EditorData.NodeContext: Watch player struggle to open a magical box.

Text.Value: What in the - are we stuck with the damn thing?
Put it away.
Those runes - this object must hold great power. It will not yield to our hands alone.
There's no getting rid of it. We'll just have to keep it hidden away.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The artefact drops to the ground, only to shoot back up into the player's hands and give them a small shock.
SFX: box flies into player's hands, electric/magic shock fx.
EditorData.SFXTags: SFX_Spells - Box flies into player's hands, and gives them a small shock

Text.Value: Huh. There's something about it, isn't there? Can an object have magnetism?
Something tells me it'll take more than a few twists to break that box open.
Tough luck. Let me know if you need to borrow a little elbow grease.
Curious artefact, isn't it? Ancient, beguiling, cryptic - the ABCs of mystery.
It's useless - believe me, I've tried.
Drop it on the ground.
*A curious, ornate box. Its many sides are engraved with githyanki scripture.*
*A curious, ornate box. Its many sides are engraved with indecipherable glyphs.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player pulls puzzle box out of inventory and examines it

Text.Value: *No openings you can see, yet you sense something inside it.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player turns the box over in their hands, holds it closer to their face, as if sensing something.

Text.Value: *You look over the box. Strange, ornate - and precious.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player pulls puzzle box out of inventory

Text.Value: Looks like that box has taken a shine to you. So unconditional, isn't it, the affection of inanimate objects?
Looks like your toy has other ideas. I think you're stuck with it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Watched player throw away a box only for it to magically return to their hands

Text.Value: *The box doesn't yield.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player tries to find purchase in the box's surfacew and pry it open.

Text.Value: *You have to protect it. You have to get it to Baldur's Gate. Shar is counting on you.*

Synopsis: The player examines a mysterious, ornate box in their possession. If the player is Shadowheart, she'll know she has to take care of this item and get it to Baldur's Gate. The player can also try to discard the box or force it open, but cannot. Companions chime in with their thoughts if present.
